sections.text: FCCPS School Board Announces Comprehensive AI Policy Development Process

AI policy, FCCPS, community engagement, teacher work group, student work group, AI advisory committee, town halls, evidence-informed, age-appropriate, parent involvement, faculty involvement, student involvement, academic year, school board, AI implications.
Anne Sherwood, Amie Murphy, Tate Gould, Bethany Anderson, Aiden Harper

The Falls Church City Public School Board announced a comprehensive AI policy development process for the upcoming school year. The goal is to create an equitable and pedagogically sound AI policy through community engagement, including teacher and staff work groups, a student work group, and an ad hoc AI Advisory Committee. Applications for the advisory committee will open soon, with the committee starting in January 2026. Town halls will be held between January and April 2026, and formal recommendations will be presented in April 2026. The policy will be reviewed in May and June 2026, aiming for implementation by the next academic year.

[ ] Launch the district-wide AI policy development process and coordinate stakeholder engagement activities for the 2025-2026 school year
[ ] Establish and convene a teacher and staff AI work group (led by Dr. Dade and Dr. Bates) to develop recommendations for the district AI policy
[ ] Establish and convene a student AI work group (facilitated by Dr. Bates) to develop recommendations for the district AI policy
[ ] Send a formal request for input from all standing School Board Advisory Committees to inform the AI policy
[ ] Open applications for the ad hoc AI Advisory Committee later this week or early next week and manage the application process
[ ] Select members for the ad hoc AI Advisory Committee before the end of the calendar year
[ ] Convene the ad hoc AI Advisory Committee beginning in January 2026
[ ] Schedule and hold town halls between late January and early April 2026 to gather community input on the AI policy

[ ] Ensure the school board receives formal recommendations from all work groups and advisory committees at the April 2026 work session and prepare first reading in May 2026 and second reading in June 2026
[ ] Invite and encourage FCCPS community members to share their perspectives on AI during regularly scheduled monthly School Board Office Hours through May 2026
